title: Trump is calling for support for his court appearance. The far right may stay away
description: Extremism researchers say online rhetoric from the far right has heated up since Trump was indicted. But they're not seeing signs that it will translate to collective violence.

title: Jodie Comer wins a Tony for her first ever performance on a professional stage
description: Still, it's safe to say that picking up the Tony for best lead actress in a play is not a case of beginner's luck.

title: A new way of teaching kids to read in Georgia
description: Georgia is changing the way students are taught to read.  This year a new law requires schools to adopt what's known as Science of Reading and Structured Literacy.

title: Why thousands of fish washed up on these Texas beaches
description: Thousands of dead fish washed ashore in southeast Texas this past weekend. The cause of death was low oxygen, meaning fish struggled to "breathe" in the warm weather.

title: Elizabeth Gilbert halts release of a new book after outcry over its Russian setting
description: The Snow Forest by the author of Eat, Pray, Love was set to be released in February 2024, exactly two years after Russia invaded Ukraine. The backlash included hundreds of negative GoodReads reviews.

title: Epstein accuser Jane Doe 1 reaches $290 million settlement with JPMorgan Chase
description: JPMorgan agreed to the settlement on the same day a federal judge granted class-action status to the lawsuit, saying the number of plaintiffs involved could be "well over 100 people."

title: Drug-maker Mallinckrodt may renege on $1.7 billion opioid settlement
description: Victims of prescription opioid addiction as well as communities slammed by the opioid crisis could wind up with nothing if Mallinckrodt files for a second bankruptcy.

title: Central Park birder Christian Cooper on being 'a Black man in the natural world'
description: Cooper was birdwatching in Central Park in 2020 when a white woman falsely accused him of threatening her. His book chronicles life as a Black birder, gay activist and Marvel comics writer and editor.

title: Biden gets a root canal (without anesthetic) and postpones some events
description: President Biden had a toothache and his medical team determined he needed a root canal. He's spending the rest of the day out of sight.

title: The U.S. says it wants to rejoin UNESCO after exiting during the Trump administration
description: The U.S. could reenter the cultural and educational body several years after it pulled out of the group citing an "anti-Israel bias" and other concerns.

title: Trump is expected to appear in a Miami court on Tuesday. Here's what to expect
description: Former president Donald Trump is expected to appear in a Miami courthouse on Tuesday after the unsealing of a federal indictment laying out 37 charges against him. Here are five things to watch for.

title: Latest in Ukraine: The counteroffensive is on, so is massive flooding
description: Catch up on key developments and the latest in-depth coverage of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

title: 5 new mysteries and thrillers for the start of summer
description: These new releases might take you from Europe to Africa to the Middle East to Russia and the United States — without leaving your hammock.

title: This week is Trump's arraignment — and birthday. Here's how he has celebrated before
description: Former president Donald Trump turns 77 on Wednesday. He's celebrated his most recent birthdays on the golf course and in the White House — but is also no stranger to lavish bashes.

title: Bolton, Trump's ex-national security adviser, calls for him to withdraw from the race
description: John Bolton says the indictment is a "potentially catastrophic turn of events" for Trump. He spoke to Morning Edition about the seriousness of the charges and the importance of accountability.

title: Indictment is catastrophic event for Trump, ex-national security adviser Bolton says
description: NPR's Steve Inskeep talks with John Bolton, a national security adviser to former President Donald Trump, about the indictment against Trump and the impact on the 2024 presidential race.

title: Silvio Berlusconi, Italy's former prime minister, has died at the age of 86
description: The media mogul turned prime minister left a mark on popular culture, while his coarseness and constant legal woes trashed political norms and tainted Italy's image in the world.

title: Children as young as 12 work legally on farms, despite years of efforts to change law
description: As some states look to roll back child labor laws, Democrats in Congress introduce a bill to increase protections for children working in agriculture that would raise the minimum age to 14.

title: LA's top make-out spots hint at a city constantly evolving
description: The creation of the automobile gave rise to a new kind of freedom and privacy, while also transforming Los Angeles into the sprawling, car-centric metropolis it is today.

title: Trump's federal indictment will loom large as Congress returns to session
description: Speaker Kevin McCarthy, who was elected to the post with Trump's support after 15 contentious rounds of votes, said House Republicans will get to the bottom of the investigation into Trump.

title: The special ingredient for Mars travel meal prep? Astronaut breath
description: Chemical physicist Stafford Sheehan invented a process that can turn carbon dioxide into yeast. It's now a finalist in the NASA-sponsored Deep Space Food Challenge.

title: The U.S. dollar conquered the world. Is it at risk of losing its top spot?
description: The dollar has helped make the U.S. the most economically powerful country for most of the last century, but other countries – including rivals like China – have the greenback on their sights.

title: Thousands of Reddit communities 'go dark' in protest of new developer fees
description: More than 6,000 so-called subreddits are participating in a 48-hour boycott aimed at pressuring the company to reverse its new fees for accessing the company's internal data.

title: 'Anti-dopamine parenting' can curb a kid's craving for screens or sweets
description: Dopamine is a part of our brain's survival mechanism. It is also part of why sugary foods and social media hook kids. The latest neuroscience can help parents help their kids manage behavior.

title: Nation's first 'drag laureate,' kicks off Pride in San Francisco
description: A nightclub owner, artist and newly elected government official is joining Pride festivities as other U.S. cities consider appointing drag laureates.

title: 60 years ago, Medgar Evers became a martyr of the Civil Rights Movement
description: On June 12, 1963, Evers was assassinated at his home in Jackson, Miss., by a Ku Klux Klan member. While other leaders pushed for equality across the U.S., Evers focused on his native Mississippi.

title: UBS finishes takeover of Credit Suisse in deal meant to stem global financial turmoil
description: UBS said Monday that it has completed its takeover of embattled rival Credit Suisse in a bid to safeguard Switzerland's reputation as a global financial center and choke off market turmoil.

title: 3 people are dead and 3 wounded in a shooting at a Maryland home, police say
description: Annapolis Police Chief Edward Jackson said at a media briefing that the shooting stemmed from what he described as an "interpersonal dispute" and that there was no further threat to the public.

title: Bus carrying wedding guests in Australia crashes and rolls, killing 10 and injuring 25
description: A bus carrying wedding guests rolled over on a foggy night in Australia's wine country, killing 10 people and injuring 25, police said. The 58-year-old driver was arrested.
